title: Add Instagram/X social icons with glow hover + streamer-mode hiding

requirements.summary: Update footer social links to show Instagram and X icons pointing to the provided profiles with modern spacing, glow hover, and responsive layout.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer shows Instagram and X icons adjacent to each other with consistent sizing and spacing.
Clicking the Instagram icon opens https://instagram.com/babu_sarraf_ji in a new tab and includes rel="noopener noreferrer".
Clicking the X icon opens https://x.com/babu_sarraf_ji in a new tab and includes rel="noopener noreferrer".
Hovering either icon shows a soft glow effect consistent with the existing dark theme.
On small screens the footer layout remains readable and the icons do not overflow or overlap other footer content.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable SocialLinks component that renders only Instagram and X icon links (react-icons) with consistent sizing/spacing, accessibility labels, and required external-link attributes (target="_blank" + rel="noopener noreferrer"). Also expose props to support reuse in header/footer and to optionally hide in streamer mode.

Replace the existing footer social links with the new SocialLinks component configured for footer usage. Ensure links point exactly to https://instagram.com/babu_sarraf_ji and https://x.com/babu_sarraf_ji and remove/avoid extra social icons so Instagram and X are adjacent with consistent spacing.

Add a small global component class (via Tailwind @layer components) for social icon links to provide the minimal/modern styling and a soft glow hover/focus-visible effect consistent with the dark study theme; apply it from SocialLinks to ensure consistent styling and responsiveness.

requirements.summary: Add Instagram and X social icons to the landing page header top-right without disrupting centered branding, matching footer styling and glow hover.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page header displays Instagram and X icons in the top-right area without disrupting the centered logo/tagline.
Both icons open the correct URLs in a new tab with rel="noopener noreferrer".
Icons are visually consistent with the footer versions (size, color, hover glow).
Header remains responsive (icons remain accessible and correctly positioned on mobile and desktop).

file_operations.description: Adjust the header layout to keep the logo/tagline centered while placing the SocialLinks component in the top-right area (near the header/profile area). Ensure the header icons use the same SocialLinks styling as the footer and remain responsive on mobile/desktop.
Ensure SocialLinks supports a header-friendly layout variant (e.g., compact sizing and alignment) while keeping icon size/color/hover glow consistent with the footer.

requirements.summary: Render optional follow text under the timer when not in streamer mode, matching the minimal study aesthetic.
acceptanceCriteria: When streamerMode is false, the text “Follow for daily study motivation – @babu_sarraf_ji” renders beneath the timer area and matches the existing typography/color system.
When streamerMode is true, the follow text is not rendered.

file_operations.description: Add the follow text “Follow for daily study motivation – @babu_sarraf_ji” directly beneath the timer display area, styled with the existing muted typography system, and conditionally render it only when streamerMode is false.

requirements.summary: Guarantee social icons on the /timer route are automatically hidden when Streamer Mode is enabled to keep browser-source overlays clean.
acceptanceCriteria: On /timer, when Streamer Mode is ON, no social icons (Instagram/X) are visible anywhere on the page.
On /timer, when Streamer Mode is OFF, social icons (if shown on that route) display normally with the same styling/hover behavior as the landing page.

file_operations.description: Add a route-level marker (e.g., a data attribute on the TimerPage root wrapper) that reflects the current streamerMode state, so CSS can automatically suppress any social icon blocks when streamerMode is enabled.

Add a scoped CSS rule that hides any elements marked as social icons/containers (as provided by SocialLinks, e.g., [data-social-links]) when the TimerPage wrapper indicates streamer mode is enabled (e.g., [data-streamer-mode="true"]). Ensure this does not affect the landing page.
Mark the SocialLinks root element with a stable selector (e.g., data-social-links) so TimerPage streamer-mode CSS can reliably hide it on /timer if SocialLinks is ever rendered there.
